Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: SAMI K
Reviews.Content: Very good location, very close to metro station,. helpful staff, clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “The best 3 stars hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Nicole D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights with my relatives and it was worth! Their rooms are well clean and with new upgraded LCD tv, friendly staffs and nice food. Big shopping malls like Al Ghurair centre and Reef Mall are walking from the hotel. It's a best place to stay if you like to explore Dubai because you don't need to ride taxi all the time as metro station is 3 minutes by walk only.

Reviews.Title: “good & nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ismail p
Reviews.Content: i booked comfort inn hotel for our trip in dubai.location wise; perfect for getting all kind of transportation;staff very friendly and helpfull.rooms are clean.would recommend it to every one.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel,very good location,excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: fateema
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, well situated about 3 minutes walk from the metro station.the rooms are very clean but kind of small, the staff is very friendly. over all it's a great value for money. would recommend it to every one.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to get to airport easily”
Reviews.Author: Jacinta B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked Comfort Inn Hotel for our last night in Dubai as we had an early flight to catch. Location wise, perfect for getting to the airport cheaply and quickly by taxi. Staff were friendly and the room was clean though slightly dated and small. It suited our needs, a shower and bed (though very hard!) before catching our flight home. The pool was shut for repairs when we were there but the hotel is quite central and we were able to easily get to shopping centres by short taxi ride. We would use this again as an airport hotel, but wouldn't stay if we were planning a few nights in Dubai as it would have been quite uncomfortable after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Confusion on check-in, but excellent thereafter”
Reviews.Author: woozie3
Reviews.Content: We booked Comfort Inn for 5 nights on hotelclub.net at the airport, about an hour before we showed up at the hotel. No doubt this contributed to the great confusion and a bit of frustration upon our check-in, since our reservation and paid deposit hadn't yet shown up on their system. When we tried to pay the remainder of the balance, the male receptionist insisted we were paying below their acceptable room rate and asked that we pay more, despite our receipt stating exactly what we should be paying and that we'd already paid the deposit, which did add up to the lowest rate the hotel would accept. We were puzzled by his insistence and failure to understand and honour our receipt. We couldn't convince him for about half an hour, but the exchange was polite enough. He spoke to someone several times on the phone to no avail and we were told the manager wasn't available till the next morning. It was after 11pm and at least, he offered us a room in the end, and told us that we can sort it out tomorrow. This situation caused a bit of stress, but we managed to get a decent night's sleep anyway. Next morning, there was a different, lady receptionist on duty and she immediately told us that everything is fine and sorted. Just a misunderstanding. Phew! We have to say though that the male receptionist remained professional at all times. In fact, all the staff that we encountered were great- very helpful with tour advice, directions etc. They also booked our Desert Safari for us. We don't have many photos of the hotel and the ones we do have may not be that flattering, but the rooms were very comfortable and clean. Everything worked. The selection of TV channels was good- Foxmovies was very entertaining. Every morning, an English newspaper was left at our door- a free service we were totally impressed by. It's a great way to get some insight into Emirati life and issues. However, construction work was going on outside, near our room, as well as renovation works on the same floor or above, so it got noisy after 8:30am. Two nights later, we were offered a different room on the 5th floor instead of the 7th. We didn't ask for it- maybe there were other people complaining? Anyway, our second room was much less spacious, particularly the bathroom which needed more hanging space. Room service here also came much earlier, at about 9am, which was too early for us. Nevertheless, this room was just as comfortable and clean as the last one. The location is quite excellent- right in front is the Kadooli supermarket. Around the corner is a small mall, where you can have McDonalds, Pizza Hut, Chinese Palace food etc. Best of all, the Union metro is just a short walk to the right of the hotel- across the street via the hanging bridge. This was so convenient and saved us some money. Also, none of the taxi drivers we encountered had any trouble finding the place. Despite the check-in issue, which wasn't fully the hotel's fault and was dealt with calmly, we'd definitely come back if we were in Dubai again, because of its combination of price, location, helpful staff, good rooms, and the free daily English newspapers. By the way, Dh$10/hr for the internet is comparable to other hotels, but it's much cheaper around the corner, near the hanging bridge and it's not charged by the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Clean But Not a good reception”
Reviews.Author: ArashAmed
Reviews.Content: we stay 5 night in this hotel rooms are Clean but little . we do n't have any problem with food . lunch and breakfast are without spices and variety of sea food , meat and chicken food be in promise . for 3 hour additional stop in room pay fare of a night 60 US$. immoral reception and bribable personal in hotel . driver , servant and porter are lover of money . good position in city and economical price

Reviews.Title: “Good location, awful breakfast, expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: Zeevee
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through expedia.com (four nights, 300 USD). it said that internet was included. Upon arrival I found out that I had to pay around 3 USD per hour. Complaints to the hotel management remained fruitless (I also complained to expedia.com who gave me a 25 USD voucher as symbolic compensation). The room was ok, though the AC blew directly on my neck when I was sitting at the desk. The shower was a big disgrace, water was luke-warm and towels were stinky. The breakfast is an experience one should not engage into. Better walk to the shopping mall across the street and have a decent coffee there. The hotel is located next to "Union" metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort inn”
Reviews.Author: Kievbugs
Reviews.Content: Went this hotel with my wife. Nice location, nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic - nothing wrong with it.”
Reviews.Author: coby3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic. It's fairly clean (except for blankets on the bed, which we removed immediately), but well maintained. Its price is good for the 3* and the drinks you may have at the hotel roof are also good. Service is fine: cleaning, reception, breakfast. They can also organise some tours for you at competitive prices (absolutely go to the desert safari!). A couple of complementary bus services exist: beach and shopping, which you may take if you're staying for 3 days+. The location is not necessarily convenient if you end up staying in town after the metro closes, but the metro and bus stops are very close, so you won't have to use taxi too often. I have no other hotel experience in Dubai, but if you're not expecting too much comfort, then Comfort Inn is a solid choice for several nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramin-Raiszadeh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Very polite and helpful staff. Requests were answered promptly. Clean rooms and good food. Very good location: A supermarket just opposite the street, and internet cafe and variety of fast food restaurants nearby. The roof-top pool was great. The bathroom was clean and good. The beds were very comfortable and clean. The only problem we could find was the towels which apparently were not dried properly, and so smelled vary bad. This was random, though, some towels did not smell,and some were not usable. In Summary, I would go to this hotel again, if I want to choose a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good and comfortable location”
Reviews.Author: Nata888
Reviews.Content: Overall, the staying was good. Staff was friendly and always available on time. Rooms were clean, but not as cosy as we expected them to be. The big problem with the restaurant buffet. Too few seats for many people. We had to stand in a queue to get seats and have our dinner. But the food was really great and diversified! Plus a lot of interferance into privacy. We could not bring our friends into our room. Small swimming pool. However, the location of the hotel compensates the abovementioned minuses. Just in front of the Al Ghurair Center, not far from Spinneys and Marks and Spencer and 10 minutes walk from Naser Square.

Reviews.Title: “very good for it's price”
Reviews.Author: Aatash
Reviews.Content: I've been there 3 nights.Lunch n dinner was so good(good with everyone's taste). It's a cheap stay but it's so good for this price cuz everything is clean,neat n tidy.the hotel is in a great area,near beach,shopping centres and all...Enjoy your trip;)

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: CAHappyTraveler7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 12 days in April 2006. It's a nice 3-star hotel. The breakfast buffet was good and the rooms were clean. For the rate of below $100, it was a nice bargain. The staff of this hotel were super friendly. I recommend this hotel to other travelers.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Rigga Street, Dubai 56352, United Arab Emirates
